body:
ואת זכר לא תשכב משכבי אשה תועבה הוא

And with a male you shall not lie down *in* the beds of a <sup>a</sup>woman, it is an abomination.

<sup>a: same word could also mean burnt offering</sup>
body_html:
ואת זכר לא תשכב משכבי אשה תועבה הוא

And with a male you shall not lie down in the beds of a awoman, it is an abomination.

a: same word could also mean burnt offering

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: There is no punctuation in ancient Hebrew. The semicolon, comma, or dash goes between אשה (woman) and תועבה (abomination).
body_html: There is no punctuation in ancient Hebrew. The semicolon, comma, or dash goes between אשה (woman) and תועבה (abomination).

body: What's the word in Latin letters? The only Hebrew word I know for burnt offering is Korban - confused how a word could mean woman and burnt offering. Just curious.

body: אשה can mean a burnt offering in biblical Hebrew. Here's a ton of examples: https://biblehub.com/hebrew/strongs_801.htm

post.body_html:

post.title: Leviticus 18:22

body:
[Catholic Haydock Commentary on the passage:](https://sensusfidelium.us/bible-catechesis/the-bible/the-book-of-leviticus/leviticus-chapter-18/)

> Ver. 22. Abomination, punished so severely in the Sodomites, Genesis xix. Yet, even the philosophers of Greece were not at all ashamed of it. Bardesanes assures us, that the eastern nations punished it with death, and would not allow the guilty the honours of burial. Those beyond the Euphrates were so shocked at it, that they would kill themselves if they were only accused of such a crime. (Ap. Eusebius, præp. vi. 10.)
body_html:
Catholic Haydock Commentary on the passage:

Ver. 22. Abomination, punished so severely in the Sodomites, Genesis xix. Yet, even the philosophers of Greece were not at all ashamed of it. Bardesanes assures us, that the eastern nations punished it with death, and would not allow the guilty the honours of burial. Those beyond the Euphrates were so shocked at it, that they would kill themselves if they were only accused of such a crime. (Ap. Eusebius, præp. vi. 10.)

body: The point of this post is to show that this is only an assumption people make and the actual statement is garbled gibberish.
